intro: Massonia sempervirens, commonly known as the evergreen massonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-green in color. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white during the spring and summer months. Massonia sempervirens is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
